Class CheckerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • CheckerPlayer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlphaBetaPlayer, HUMANPlayer, RANDOMPlayer

    public abstract class CheckerPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an abstract class that must be inherited by every checker player you create.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Move chosenMove
      This is the move chosen by a player when the calculateMove method is called.
      protected java.lang.String playerName
      This is the name given to the player.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CheckerPlayer(java.lang.String name)
      This is the constructor for a CheckerPlayer and should be called via super(...) whenever a subclass of this class is created.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void calculateMove(int[][] boardState, int whosTurn)
      This method must be overriden by any subclass of this class.
      Move getMove()
      This method is used to retrieve the move chosen by this player when the calculateMove method was called.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • playerName

        protected java.lang.String playerName
        This is the name given to the player.

      • chosenMove

        protected Move chosenMove
        This is the move chosen by a player when the calculateMove method is called. The player should update this variable as soon as it finds a better move, because the calculateMove method will be interupted by a timer after some amount of time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CheckerPlayer

        public CheckerPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        This is the constructor for a CheckerPlayer and should be called via super(...) whenever a subclass of this class is created.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMove

        public abstract void calculateMove(int[][] boardState,
                                   int whosTurn)
        This method must be overriden by any subclass of this class. This method will eventually be interupted, so you should use a copy of the board state when you do your calculations to ensure that you don't change the board state if this thread is killed before it completes.
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you need to choose the next move.
        whosTurn - This indicates which player you need to choose a move for given the specified board state (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).

      • getMove

        public Move getMove()
        This method is used to retrieve the move chosen by this player when the calculateMove method was called.
        Returns:
        The return value is the Move chosen during the calculateMove method.
